column4: I would _never_ resize on _any_ system without a backup, regardless of what anyone might tell you.  Plus, t4 is telling you he has direct experience.
Right... And the only things I need are already backed up (I do regular backups). BUT I cannot figure out how to do it in the first place.
ok, you would be surprised how many people do a resize and lose important data.
I didn't see the specifics of your system, it's power pc?
I've never done a resize on those.
OK... It's just strange because (#1 I'm not stupid) many people told me that the PPC Ubuntu had resizing as an install option... and I can't for the life of me find it.
I've never seen resizing as an install option with any version.
I've seen many people resize, but not during install.
so use whatever tool you want to resize with.  use a rescue cd or boot the ubuntu install cd in rescue mode
How would I do that? (rescue mode from ubuntu cd)... and does it include parted?
I don't know whether parted is there or not, sorry.  If you hit F1 at the boot prompt, it tells you how to get into rescue mode.
I don't think the OS X bootstrap has the option to hit F1
possible, I haven't tried it recently.
in fact, I don't think I've tried the mac with ubuntu at all.
so google or find somebody smarter than I am about ubuntu and ppc.  :)
OK... thank you for your help!
